misconceptions.inferred_category_name: No conceptual error detected (correct right-shift with wraparound)
misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes they must save the last element, shift the rest of the array from right to left (high index down to 1), then place the saved last element into index 0.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: None. This matches Java’s execution model for in-place array shifting: copying from right-to-left prevents overwriting values that are still needed.
misconceptions.error_manifestation: None (produces correct shifted array for N > 0; for N == 0 it prints an empty shifted array, which is reasonable unless the spec forbids N=0).
